block.p: When humans encounter stress, they will, by instinct, choose ''fight or flight'' -- or so goes the accepted wisdom. The trouble is, that wisdom is based largely on the study of men. But guess what? According to a study in the journal Psychological Review, women are different. Instead of slugging or running when demons appear, they ''tend and befriend'' -- they stick together and nurture children. A good thing, too, the study suggests: it would have been an evolutionary disaster if no one had protected the young.
